member.name: T:Fluent.NativeMethods
member.summary: Native methods

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_GETSYSMENU
member.summary: 'Famous' undocumented WM_GETSYSMENU message to display own context menu

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to all top-level windows when Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition has been enabled or disabled.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_NCRBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_NCACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_NCACTIVATE message is sent to a window when its nonclient area needs to be changed to indicate an active or inactive state

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_PAINT
member.summary: The WM_PAINT message is sent when the system or another application makes a request to paint a portion of an application's window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_ERASEBKGND
member.summary: The WM_ERASEBKGND message is sent when the window background must be erased (for example, when a window is resized). The message is sent to prepare an invalidated portion of a window for painting.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_SETREDRAW
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETREDRAW message to a window to allow changes in that window to be redrawn or to prevent changes in that window from being redrawn.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_CREATE
member.summary: The WM_CREATE message is sent when an application requests that a window be created by calling the CreateWindowEx or CreateWindow function. (The message is sent before the function returns.) The window procedure of the new window receives this message after the window is created, but before the window becomes visible

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_SETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETTEXT message to set the text of a window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_SETICON
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETICON message to associate a new large or small icon with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog box, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_SETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent to all top-level windows when the SystemParametersInfo function changes a system-wide setting or when policy settings have changed.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window after it enters the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the err! bad pv reference "SC_MOVE" [type 'winnotify' not supported.] or err! bad pv reference "SC_SIZE" [type 'winnotify' not supported.] value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_EXITSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_EXITSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window, after it has exited the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the err! bad pv reference "SC_MOV" [type 'winnotify' not supported.]E or err! bad pv reference "SC_SIZE" [type 'winnotify' not supported.] value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WVR_HREDRAW
member.summary: Used in combination with any other values, except WVR_VALIDRECTS, causes the window to be completely redrawn if the client rectangle changes size horizontally. This value is similar to CS_HREDRAW class style

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WVR_VREDRAW
member.summary: Used in combination with any other values, except WVR_VALIDRECTS, causes the window to be completely redrawn if the client rectangle changes size vertically. This value is similar to CS_VREDRAW class style

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WVR_REDRAW
member.summary: This value causes the entire window to be redrawn. It is a combination of WVR_HREDRAW and WVR_VREDRAW values.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MF_ENABLED
member.summary: Enables the menu item so that it can be selected and restores it from its grayed state.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MF_BYCOMMAND
member.summary: Indicates that the uPosition parameter specifies the identifier of the menu item (the default).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MF_GRAYED
member.summary: Disables the menu item and grays it so that it cannot be selected.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MF_DISABLED
member.summary: Disables the menu item so that it cannot be selected, but this flag does not gray it.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.RGN_AND
member.summary: Creates the intersection of the two combined regions.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.RGN_OR
member.summary: Creates the union of two combined regions.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.RGN_XOR
member.summary: Creates the union of two combined regions except for any overlapping areas.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.RGN_DIFF
member.summary: Combines the parts of hrgnSrc1 that are not part of hrgnSrc2.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.RGN_COPY
member.summary: Creates a copy of the region identified by hrgnSrc1.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_NORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_SIZE
member.summary: Sizes the window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_MOVE
member.summary: Moves the window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_NEXTWINDOW
member.summary: Moves to the next window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_PREVWINDOW
member.summary: Moves to the previous window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_CLOSE
member.summary: Closes the window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_VSCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls vertically.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_HSCROLL
member.summary: Scrolls horizontally.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_MOUSEMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a mouse click.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_KEYMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a keystroke.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_RESTORE
member.summary: Restores the window to its normal position and size.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_TASKLIST
member.summary: Activates the Start menu.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_SCREENSAVE
member.summary: Executes the screen saver application specified in the [boot] section of the System.ini file.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_HOTKEY
member.summary: Activates the window associated with the application-specified hot key. The lParam parameter identifies the window to activate.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_DEFAULT
member.summary: Selects the default item; the user double-clicked the window menu.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_MONITORPOWER
member.summary: Sets the state of the display. This command supports devices that have power-saving features, such as a battery-powered personal computer. The lParam parameter can have the following values: -1 - the display is powering on 1 - the display is going to low power 2 - the display is being shut off

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SC_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Changes the cursor to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTNOWHERE
member.summary: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTCLIENT
member.summary: In a client area.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTCAPTION
member.summary: In a title bar

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTLEFT
member.summary: In the left border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTRIGHT
member.summary: In the right border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTTOP
member.summary: In the upper-horizontal border of a window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTTOPLEFT
member.summary: In the upper-left corner of a window border.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTTOPRIGHT
member.summary: In the upper-right corner of a window border.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTBOTTOM
member.summary: In the lower-horizontal border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window vertically).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTBOTTOMLEFT
member.summary: In the lower-left corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HTBOTTOMRIGHT
member.summary: In the lower-right corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_NCHITTEST
member.summary: The WM_NCHITTEST message is sent to a window when the cursor moves, or when a mouse button is pressed or released. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_NCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_NCPAINT message is sent to a window when its frame must be painted.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_NCCREATE
member.summary: The WM_NCCREATE message is sent prior to the WM_CREATE message when a window is first created

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_NCDESTROY
member.summary: The WM_NCDESTROY message informs a window that its nonclient area is being destroyed. The DestroyWindow function sends the WM_NCDESTROY message to the window following the WM_DESTROY message. WM_DESTROY is used to free the allocated memory object associated with the window. The WM_NCDESTROY message is sent after the child windows have been destroyed. In contrast, WM_DESTROY is sent before the child windows are destroyed.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_NCCALCSIZE
member.summary: The WM_NCCALCSIZE message is sent when the size and position of a window's client area must be calculated. By processing this message, an application can control the content of the window's client area when the size or position of the window changes.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_GETMINMAXINFO
member.summary: The WM_GETMINMAXINFO message is sent to a window when the size or position of the window is about to change. An application can use this message to override the window's default maximized size and position, or its default minimum or maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_SIZE
member.summary: The WM_SIZE message is sent to a window after its size has changed.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WM_MOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOVE message is sent after a window has been moved

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SIZE_RESTORED
member.summary: The window has been resized, but neither the SIZE_MINIMIZED nor SIZE_MAXIMIZED value applies.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SIZE_MINIMIZED
member.summary: The window has been minimized.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SIZE_MAXIMIZED
member.summary: The window has been maximized.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Creates a window that has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Gives window generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: Displays the window text using left-to-right reading order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Places a vertical scroll bar (if present) to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.GWL_STYLE
member.summary: Sets a new window style.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.GWL_EXSTYLE
member.summary: Sets a new extended window style. For more information, see CreateWindowEx.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.GWL_HWNDPARENT
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the parent window, if any

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HWND_TOP
member.summary: Places the window at the top of the Z order.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.HWND_NOTOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: M:Fluent.NativeMethods.TrackPopupMenuEx(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The TrackPopupMenuEx function displays a shortcut menu at the specified location and tracks the selection of items on the shortcut menu. The shortcut menu can appear anywhere on the screen.
member.param: Handle to the shortcut menu to be displayed. This handle can be obtained by calling the CreatePopupMenu function to create a new shortcut menu or by calling the GetSubMenu function to retrieve a handle to a submenu associated with an existing menu item.
Horizontal location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.
Vertical location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates

Handle to the window that owns the shortcut menu. This window receives all messages from the menu. The window does not receive a WM_COMMAND message from the menu until the function returns. If you specify TPM_NONOTIFY in the fuFlags parameter, the function does not send messages to the window identified by hwnd. However, you must still pass a window handle in hwnd. It can be any window handle from your application.
Pointer to a TPMPARAMS structure that specifies an area of the screen the menu should not overlap. This parameter can be NULL.
member.returns: If you specify TPM_RETURNCMD in the fuFlags parameter, the return value is the menu-item identifier of the item that the user selected. If the user cancels the menu without making a selection, or if an error occurs, then the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Fluent.NativeMethods.GetSystemMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The GetSystemMenu function allows the application to access the window menu (also known as the system menu or the control menu) for copying and modifying.
member.param: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu.

Specifies the action to be taken. If this parameter is FALSE, GetSystemMenu returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified. If this parameter is TRUE, GetSystemMenu resets the window menu back to the default state. The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.
member.returns: If the bRevert parameter is FALSE, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu. If the bRevert parameter is TRUE, the return value is NULL.

(Pointers and handles are 32 bits on 32-bit Microsoft Windows and 64 bits on 64-bit Windows.) To write code that is compatible with both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows, use GetWindowLongPtr.

member.name: M:Fluent.NativeMethods.GetClassLongPtr(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The GetClassLongPtr function retrieves the specified value from the WNDCLASSEX structure associated with the specified window. If you are retrieving a pointer or a handle, this function supersedes the GetClassLong function. (Pointers and handles are 32 bits on 32-bit Microsoft Windows and 64 bits on 64-bit Windows.) To write code that is compatible with both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows, use GetClassLongPtr.
member.param: Handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.

Specifies the value to retrieve. To retrieve a value from the extra class memory, specify the positive, zero-based byte offset of the value to be retrieved. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra class memory, minus eight; for example, if you specified 24 or more bytes of extra class memory, a value of 16 would be an index to the third integer. To retrieve any other value from the WNDCLASSEX structure, specify one of the following values.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the requested value.If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.summary: Specifies the x-coordinate of the point.

member.name: T:Fluent.NativeMethods.MINMAXINFO
member.summary: The MINMAXINFO structure contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MINMAXINFO.ptReserved
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximized width (POINT.x) and the maximized height (POINT.y) of the window. For top-level windows, this value is based on the width of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position of the left side of the maximized window (POINT.x) and the position of the top of the maximized window (POINT.y). For top-level windows, this value is based on the position of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MINMAXINFO.ptMinTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum tracking width (POINT.x) and the minimum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMINTRACK and SM_CYMINTRACK.

member.name: F:Fluent.NativeMethods.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum tracking width (POINT.x) and the maximum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value is based on the size of the virtual screen and can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMAXTRACK and SM_CYMAXTRACK.

member.name: T:Fluent.NativeMethods.EnumChildProc
member.summary: The EnumChildProc function is an application-defined callback function used with the EnumChildWindows function. It receives the child window handles. The WNDENUMPROC type defines a pointer to this callback function. EnumChildProc is a placeholder for the application-defined function name.
member.param: Handle to a child window of the parent window specified in EnumChildWindows
Specifies the application-defined value given in EnumChildWindows
member.returns: To continue enumeration, the callback function must return TRUE; to stop enumeration, it must return FALSE

member.summary: AreClose returns whether or not two doubles are "close". That is, whether or not they are within epsilon of each other.
